newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 30.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The Philippines will file a diplomatic protest against China over the intrusion of three armed Chinese Navy frigates in the Kalayaan chain of islands and the building of a new structure on another reef, the Palace said yesterday. (TODAY/STANDARD/INQUIRER/MALAYA)

- The Supreme Court yesterday finally dropped a motion to postpone the May 12 town elections, saying that the petition was a "self-serving proposition to lengthen governance without a mandate from the governed." (STANDARD/BULLETIN/TIMES)
- President Ramos leaves on May 6 for an 11-day trip to the United States, Mexico and Panama to deliver a major policy speech and pursue his administration's economic diplomacy. (BULLETIN)
- The Monetary Board has imposed restrictions on local banks' exposure in the property development sector. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)
- Fears of a reversal in the property sector and the disappointing first quarter earnings of market heavyweights pulled down the Philippine Stock Exchange index to a 15-month low. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)
- Government economic managers are confident the country's economic growth would continue in the high side in the next year and beyond. (BULLETIN)
